Having over 800 hrs (PC and Xbox included) I can say I enjoyed my time with the game up until about a year ago.
I personally had issues with the SBMM but it could just be a me thing.
Now with that, I would absolutely recommend any and everybody to give this game a shot especially when its on sale just to see if you like it or not. Some of the community can be pretty toxic but thats with any game. Most of the time when I asked other for help when I was starting most of the community is pretty friendly at explaining how things work for ex: The perks and the tools you can use as survivor. Killer on the other hand, you'll have just have to find the right person im not too familiar on that one, there are plenty of YouTube videos to seek out for specific killers and their abilities. With that, I think the killers that are unique & Original in this game really hit while the licensed ones are almost lack luster because of the lack of cosmetics and some balancing issues. I would love to see a ton more done with them as well.

With all of this said Id say give it a try, you could play for just a few hours or spend hundreds like myself and others getting lost in this game. Enjoy your time in the Entity's Realm
- A Filthy Survivor Main

A little bit a of a learning curve since there are a ton of variable between characters and survivors. Given it being out for 6 years now the developers stay current to critical issues and stable gameplay for all (crossplay included). Game feels complete when you add more of the dlc included or free to play actions to acquire them. Game works better if everyone does their part to win, friends always better to play with. 8.3/10

This game used to be fun every game, I would recommend this to any beginner, and even more so to anyone wanting to play as a killer. this game is more survivor friendly, it seems with every update survivors get more broken. they have environment, they have perks, items, and teammates, almost every match will have survivors in party chats to tell each-other what the killer is doing or where they place their traps. sometime you will get a normal game where it is fun. you will have more unbalanced games that are not fun. survivors can do gens in less than 7 mins even when you are trying to defend gens, which leaves no time for chasing or doing any killing. games is going down hill fast. try prop hunt

Mas como todo jogo online você pode se estressar com o coleguinha da equipe (se jogar de sobrevivente) ou se estressar com sua própria burrice (ai vale para os dois, tanto sobrevivente como assassino).
O jogo fica mais divertido se estiver em call com os outros jogadores.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I guess it's about time to write a review for this game, but the amount of hours that I have should be enough to convince you that the game is worth playing. I want to start by saying that I have every achievement and tome completed. This game has been a love/hate roller coaster throughout the time I have been apart of it. I would add that it looks like the developers are listening to the community when they make many of their large decisions. I hope that continues.

The premise is simple enough: It's tag with killers and survivors. There is far more nuance to it than that, but if you really want to invest time into the game I would suggest you look at a guide and some youtube videos. I don't normally recommend solo queues as a survivor for anyone with any significant amount of time greater than 10 hours, but playing survivor solo queues is fine if you're just starting out. The experience of doing so will begin to enrage you when you see your team-mates make stupid mistakes, help the killer, or sit in a corner with various perks that don't help you complete objectives. Yes, this game is very objective based. Repair 5 generators and leave out of the gate without being hooked by a killer. The survivors aren't as active in this game as they are in other games of the same genre, but as things develop you'll probably see new mechanics and various things come in by way of the development team. 

Looking Forward the game still has life in it. The game has dipped from 100,000 regular users to 40,000 and then back to 100,000 during the event, so it's far from being a dead game. One of the things that I most appreciate about this game is that I never felt like losses come down to who can twitch their controller the fastest, and there is always a fair amount of strategic depth to each match. There are enough maps and players that the game, despite the simple premise, never really feels stale; in fact, it's quite the opposite! It borders on a horrible addiction at times, and as I write this I have come to the conclusion that I myself need a break from this game.

idk how some people spend so much time on a game (500-1000++ hours!) and then go on to write a negative review on it. I no longer play DBD on a regular basis as I did, but one thing's for certain. I liked it. That's why I have 200 hours on it, that's why I bought DLCs along the way, and for all the things i mentioned, that's why i recommend it. I wont cry about losing most of my games or about meeting (a very small amount of) toxic people on the internet lol. stop spreading bs, if you have so many hours on record, you enjoyed it or else you got obsessed with it. you can't false a studio because you realised after DAYS, or better, WEEKS (as a week has a total of 24x7 hours=168 hours) of gameplay you've spent that you suddenly "hate" the game after all. i get so pissed when i read such reviews on any game, not just on this one.

I bought this game back in 2015 or around that.  I am very impress with how far this game has improved. They have an excellent range of survivors and killers and it continues to grow. This game can be fun with or without friends. No friends online? Try to main a killer and you will enjoy your improvement. The the rank system can tell you how you are progressing. Also you can prestige and get some cool cosmetics with selected killer. Same goes for your favorite survivors and so on. Of course with all the different and unique killers some will be better than others. If you do enjoy a certain killer you will get better. I play as Pyramid Head and getting better with his lack of pace with perks and precision judgement placements. I saw this on sale for like 6$ which is a steal. I'm not the guy to ask about the  ranking and most competitive tiers. I play this game casual and I have fun. I can always come back to the game from time to time and they still keep it fun!
